cityStats.description:
In cities like Sydney or Melbourne, this is decent but not extravagantâ€”expect tight budgets on rent and daily costs.

In regional areas or smaller cities like Adelaide, Hobart, or Perth, you could live quite comfortably.

Australia generally has higher average wages, so while NZD 100K feels upper-middle class in NZ, it's more of a comfortable middle-tier income in Australia.

To find out further information about cities in Australia sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In major metropolitan areas like New York City or San Francisco, living costs are among the highest in the world, requiring substantial income for comfortable living.

Mid-sized cities like Austin, Denver, or Seattle offer a better balance of opportunity and affordability.

The USA has significant regional cost variations, with Southern and Midwest states generally being more affordable than coastal areas.

To find out further information about cities in the USA sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In London, costs are significantly higher than the rest of the UK, with rent being a major expense.

Cities like Manchester, Birmingham, or Edinburgh offer good quality of life at lower costs while still providing excellent amenities.

The UK's cost of living varies greatly between London and other regions, with the capital typically 30-50% more expensive.

To find out further information about cities in the UK sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In Tokyo, costs are high but balanced by excellent public services and infrastructure.

Cities like Osaka, Kyoto, or Fukuoka offer similar quality of life at 20-30% lower costs.

Japan offers excellent value in healthcare and transportation, though imported goods can be expensive.

To find out further information about cities in Japan sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In cities like Toronto or Vancouver, housing costs have surged in recent years, making them among the most expensive in North America.

Cities like Montreal, Calgary, or Ottawa offer more affordable living while maintaining high quality of life.

Canada offers excellent public services and healthcare, with costs varying significantly by province.

To find out further information about cities in Canada sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In cities like Zurich or Geneva, costs are among the highest globally, but salaries are proportionally higher.

Smaller cities like Bern, Lausanne, or Basel offer slightly lower costs while maintaining Switzerland's high quality of life.

Switzerland's high costs are offset by excellent infrastructure, healthcare, and safety, plus lower tax rates in some cantons.

To find out further information about cities in Switzerland sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In Beijing or Shanghai, costs for expats can be high, especially for Western-style accommodation and imported goods.

Second-tier cities like Chengdu, Hangzhou, or Xi'an offer excellent quality of life at much lower costs.

China offers great value for local food, transportation, and services, though international products are expensive.

To find out further information about cities in China sign up to SMRT | TRVL.

In major cities like Paris, Amsterdam, or Munich, costs are high but generally lower than London or Zurich.

Southern and Eastern European cities like Lisbon, Barcelona, or Prague offer excellent value with lower costs.

The Eurozone offers great mobility and healthcare, with significant cost variations between north and south.

To find out further information about cities in Europe sign up to SMRT | TRVL.
